@vidakovic this (asciidoc) was more your thing than mine, if memory serves me right? I'll leave this to you.

PS: Just FYI, I'm (meanwhile) a reasonably happy user of https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/, based on https://www.mkdocs.org, for something that I'm toying with on https://docs.enola.dev personally. I've also set it up on https://google.github.io/android-fhir/. The Markdown (MD) syntax is nice.
I will review this as soon as I can, no problem.

I have seen you changed the business logic without changing the created test case. If the build is green this means two things:
- either the test case is faulty and without any changes it would be green
- It is testing the wrong thing

body: @wkigenyi any plans to continue this PR?
Yes I work on it. Been busy with some back log.
Apologies, went into paternity leave and just got back. Will create a new pull request.

> Apologies, went into paternity leave and just got back. Will create a new pull request.

Congratulations for the baby! :)
Thank you 😊
@DavidLemayian Please squash your commits and try to avoid merge commits. We prefer rebasing ;)

> @alberto-art3ch is this the first piece of a bigger PR? I mean I get the new flag but it doesn't do anything in terms of calculation. Will that come further down the road or it was missed from this PR accidentally?

@galovics The short answer is yes, this is only the flag introduction for this feature, there will be more PRs for adding the logic related for Interest Recognition
v1.11 is coming soon... we don't want this in 1.11, right? Just trying to keep an eye on this since I'm working with James on the v1.11 release today.
@meonkeys ... I'd say let's leave this one out of 1.11 ... it would have no impact, but still, let's keep this one out. Feel free to progress with the release.

Perfect, thanks @vidakovic . Should be easy as long as it isn't merged into `develop` before we branch for v1.11 in about a couple weeks.

Cc: @jdailey

body:
### Renovate Ignore Notification

Because you closed this PR without merging, Renovate will ignore this update. You will not get PRs for *any* future `11.x` releases. But if you manually upgrade to `11.x` then Renovate will re-enable `minor` and `patch` updates automatically.

If you accidentally closed this PR, or if you changed your mind: rename this PR to get a fresh replacement PR.

performed_via_github_app.name: Forking Renovate
performed_via_github_app.description:
![header](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/whitesource_renovate_660_220.jpg)

"Forking Renovate" is the sister app to Mend's [Renovate Bot](https://github.com/apps/renovate) app. The difference is that Forking Renovate operates using forks of repositories instead of as a collaborator, so needs only read-only permissions rather than read-write. It works on public (e.g. open source) repositories only.

Please see the Renovate Bot page and documentation for further details.

body: Thanks @adamsaghy . Let me know if fine?

@a7med3del1973 please squash your commits!
@adamsaghy squash done

@a7med3del1973 Please make sure you always include the proper Fineract jira ticket in the PR title and in the commit message as well.
Example:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-2081: Minor bug-fixes and enhancements of 1.11.0

So PR title and commit message could be the following:
FINERACT-2081: Remove unnecessary `toString` method calls and fix typo
